page.title: 08ROYAL NAVAL CEMETRY
page.content: The R.N. cemetry was built around the 1800's. It is well kept. It has numerous graves and still has room for more. There is a small chapel that is used for burial services. A case in the wall contains a register of all the people buried in plot D. They are in the register because they do not have gravestones. There is a fenced area that has the graves of foreign sailors. On the gravestone there are crests of the regiments to which the deceased belonged. The youngest person buried was nine years old. A large monument has been erected in memory of those who died in France and Belgium. Also buried here are sailors killed in both World Wars and the Falklands.
